name: ListAccountTags
description:
Retrieve all tags for your Pagerduty account.

This tool fetches all tags from your Pagerduty account, which can be used to filter escalation policies, teams, or users. Use this tool when you need a complete list of tags associated with your account.

parameters.name: version_accept_header
parameters.description: Specifies the API version via the `Accept` header to control the format of the response.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: response_content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the response format. Use 'application/json' to receive JSON responses.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of tag results to return per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset index from where to start returning paginated search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: label_filter
parameters.description: Filter results to show only tags with labels matching the specified query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the tags whose label matches the query.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to include the total count in the pagination response, otherwise it will remain null for faster responses.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filters the result, showing only the tags whose label matches the query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the tags whose label matches the query.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.
